intro: Eremogone capillaris var. americana, commonly known as the American sand verbena, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, showy pink or purple flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions. Its botanical characteristics make it an important component of xerophytic plant communities.
